pr_title: Formatting of code snippets in README.md.

timeline.message:
Update README.md

Use a standard indentation in all snippets. Add language cues to GitHub-flavored code segments.

timeline.bodyText: I never know whether I should use groovy or gradle here. It looks like Github support both. Do you know any reason to use one over the other?
timeline.author: martinbonnin

replies.bodyText: Github supports both not everywhere. I think our docs site may not support it actually
replies.author: tasomaniac

replies.bodyText: For Gradle stuff, especially for simple things like this, I started to put only Kotlin since it also is valid in Groovy
replies.author: tasomaniac

replies.bodyText:
If I understand your meaning, I could use kotlin as the format flavor?
I found an example docs page which includes this block:
```kotlin:title=build.gradle
// Replace:
implementation("com.apollographql.apollo:apollo-android-support:x.y.z")

// With:
implementation("com.apollographql.apollo:apollo-normalized-cache-sqlite:x.y.z") // highlight-line
```

The rest are ```groovy.
